meanings.definition: Have enough money or resources to pay for something.
meanings.sent1: I can afford to buy a new toy with my allowance.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't afford the expensive dress, so she chose a cheaper one.
meanings.sent3: I can afford to lose a few dollars in a bet, but not too much!
meanings.sent4: His generosity affords him many friends who appreciate his kindness.
meanings.sent5: Being able to afford a comfortable life is a goal for many people.

meanings.definition: Be able to do something without risk or adverse consequences.
meanings.sent1: I can afford to take a day off work without any problems.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't afford to make any mistakes during the important presentation.
meanings.sent3: I can afford to skip breakfast today since I had a big dinner last night.
meanings.sent4: Her experience affords her the confidence to tackle any challenge that comes her way.
meanings.sent5: Having a reliable car affords me the freedom to travel wherever I want.
